nodes.text: A T-series tactical droid served the droid army of the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the Clone Wars. With the end of the war and the formation of the Galactic Empire, the Separatist battle droids were decommissioned. The T-series tactical droid was set to be destroyed at a decommissioning facility on the planet Corellia.

The tactical droid was saved from its fate, however; due to the value of the intelligence that such droids held, two parties—the Bad Batch, former clone commandos working as mercenaries for the informant Cid, and the Martez sisters, whose client wished to use the droid's data to resist the Empire—sought to retrieve one before all of the Separatist droids were destroyed. By the time that the clone troopers entered the facility, the tactical droid was the only droid of its kind remaining in the factory, with the others already having been melted down. Its remains were situated on one of the factory's conveyers, with its head detached from its body. Before the clones could retrieve the droid's head, however, it was taken by Trace Martez.

The two groups briefly competed to secure the droid, but eventually worked together to fight against the police droids as the facility was placed into lockdown. The clone Tech was able to reactivate the droid's head, programming it to command the other battle droids to target the police droids. As the battle droids fought back against the police droids, the Bad Batch and the Martez sisters escaped, though one of the police droids shot the tactical droid's head out of Trace's hands, destroying it. As the two groups parted ways, the clones' leader, Hunter, provided Rafa Martez with a memory rod containing the tactical droid's intelligence, which Tech had previously downloaded.

The tactical droid appeared, albeit unidentified, in "Decommissioned," the sixth episode of Star Wars: The Bad Batch, released on Disney+ on June 4, 2021. The droid was voiced by Liam O'Brien and designed by Stephan A. Carey.
